channel.title: Sidebar interfaces explained
channel.description:
[size=14pt]Sidebar interfaces explained – Revision 317[/size]
While most of the tutorial will be standard to the average user, some may find this useful.
When logging into a revision 317 Runescape private server you will notice one of two things concerning the sidebar (inventory, stats, spell book and etcetera). First they will follow the same layout as Runescape back in its early stages or it will be customized. It is actually very easy to change them.
Upon logging in—no matter what source you’re using a packet is sent to the client which sets these interfaces. The packet ID is [b]71[/b]. For you Winterlove (or a derivative) users this is usually done using this method: [code] outStream.sendFrame(71); [/code] Or [code] outStream.createFrame(71); [/code] After sending that packet, the client is expecting a following short and byte from the server. The short will indicate which interface you want to set and the byte will indicate the sidebar “tab”.
Here is a list of the IDs for both the interfaces and forms:
[table] [tr][td]Sidebar [/td][td]Byte [/td][td]Short[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Combat[/td][td]0[/td][td]2423[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Stats[/td][td]1[/td][td]3917[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Quests[/td][td]2[/td][td]638[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Inventory[/td][td]3[/td][td]3213[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Equipment[/td][td]4[/td][td]1644[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Prayer[/td][td]5[/td][td]5608[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Spell book[/td][td]6[/td][td]1151[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Blank[/td][td]7[/td][td]Null – This is the blank tab to the left of friends.[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Friends list[/td][td]8[/td][td]5065[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Ignores list[/td][td]9[/td][td]5715[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Log out[/td][td]10[/td][td]2449[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Settingsk[/td][td]11[/td][td]4445[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Player controls[/td][td]12[/td][td]147[/td][/tr]
[tr][td]Audio player[/td][td]13[/td][td]6299[/td][/tr] [/table]
Each sidebar must be manually set, and should be the last thing done after login with the exception of say a login or greeting message. In Winterlove servers the method that is used to set these is the setSideInterface(int sidebar, int interface).
Some common uses for this would be during banking when all the sidebars are disabled besides the inventory, or when the standard spell book is swapped over to another such as ancient or lunar magics. If you want to add a custom skill to a revision 317 server the blank tab can be used, possibly in conjunction with Lin’s interface maker and a custom sprite.
If there is already a tutorial on this, please inform me and I’ll remove mine.

item.title: Sidebar interfaces explained
item.dc:creator: @i_code_rsps i code rsps
item.description:
@i_code_rsps wrote:

[quote=“wavemaker, post:12, topic:378972”]This is pretty good, you explained it very well. I bet a couple people wouldn’t have known what packet sends the sidebar information to the client.
I hope to see a lot more explained tutorials/snippets from you.
Rep for you good sir :)[/quote]

You can’t rep bro :P.


Rep++ needed the list :)

Read full topic

item.description:
@wavemaker wrote:

This is pretty good, you explained it very well. I bet a couple people wouldn’t have known what packet sends the sidebar information to the client.
I hope to see a lot more explained tutorials/snippets from you.
Rep for you good sir

item.title: Sidebar interfaces explained
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

Thank you everyone for the positive feedback.

Read full topic

item.title: Sidebar interfaces explained
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Dcrew Mod Dcrew
item.description:
@Mod_Dcrew wrote:

Nice, Thx for the list! Rep++

Read full topic

item.title: Sidebar interfaces explained
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

Ahh thanks, I needed the bytes and shorts for a well long time. Cookies and rep for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Sidebar interfaces explained
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Dastan_:

Delete this shit or believe me you’ll get flammed. And you don’t want that

Don’t be a troll.

I was actually expecting “ok so pirst u gotz to do setsidebarinterface(2, 9) den it work!”

Then I saw “Started by wintercanon” So I knew it wasn’t going to be like that.

You actually taught something (Isn’t common here), like when you started talking about how the client sends and recieves packets. Plus you talked about how it’s expecting a byte and short from the server. I know LOTS of people that don’t know these things.

Nice tutorial.

Read full topic

item.title: Sidebar interfaces explained
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Well we have a snippets topic, not a section. I actually don’t have a problem with this staying in the tutorial section though.

Read full topic

item.title: Sidebar interfaces explained
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:5, topic:378972”]Pretty much common sense, should go in a wiki somewhere. But to keep tab 7 blank, you send -1 and it wont even be clickable.

Some common uses for this would be during banking when all the sidebars are disabled besides the inventory

The client already handles this. It even hides the sideicons, but when idiots draw them directly on the tab, thats where we get problems.[/quote]Well there was no snippit section so I debated putting this in tutorials or development… Sending a short -1 for 7 is the same as not even building it. I haven’t started writing a banking system for my source so I didn’t know the disabled tabs during banking were client-sided.

If this “tutorial” is useless, by all means contact a moderator to remove it.

Read full topic

item.title: Sidebar interfaces explained
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Pretty much common sense, should go in a wiki somewhere. But to keep tab 7 blank, you send -1 and it wont even be clickable.

Wintercanon:

Some common uses for this would be during banking when all the sidebars are disabled besides the inventory

The client already handles this. It even hides the sideicons, but when idiots draw them directly on the tab, thats where we get problems.

Read full topic

item.description:
